docs.snippet: ORLANDO, Fla., Jan. 27-Internal discord and organizational failures of a severity rarely seen in a Presidential campaign are plaguing President Ford's campaign in Florida, according to well-placed Presidential aides....
docs.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla., Jan. 27-Internal discord and organizational failures of a severity rarely seen in a Presidential campaign are plaguing President Ford's campaign in Florida, according to well-placed Presidential aides.
docs.abstract: Pres Ford's Fla campaign is reptdly beset by almost unprecedented internal discord and orgn failures; aides fear resulting 'confusion and discontent' might jeopardize his uphill effort to beat Ronald Reagan in state's Mar 9 primary; Ford's Washington associates may dispatch more organizers from Washington and/or replace Repr Louis Frey Jr as Fla campaign mgr; White House press sec Ron Nessen predicts Ford will get 'clobbered' in primary; blames Frey, whose appearance at Lincoln Day dinner at which Reagan was main speaker further convinced some that he is interested in promoting himself rather than Ford; Ford was also hurt by remark of his natl campaign mgr, Howard H Callaway, who admitted trying to get White House to delay 2d bribery trial of former Fla Sen Edward J Gurney lest Fla conservatives be angered (L)

headline.main: Ford Florida Drive Held in Peril Over Discord and Poor Planning; Ford's Florida Campaign Held in Peril

byline.original: By R.W. APPLE Jr. Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: gala benefit show is held at Kennedy Center in tribute to its chmn Roger L Stevens; those attending include Pres and Mrs Ford, Vice Pres and Mrs Rockefeller, Mrs Onassis, Alejandro Orfila, Sec Kissinger, Sen Edward M Kennedy, Rose Kennedy and Maria and Eunice Shriver; those performing include Isaac Stern, Pinchas Zuckerman, Allegra Kent, Edward Villella; Henry Fonda is master of ceremonies; illus (M)

docs.snippet: HORN OF PLENTY Vanessa Redgrave and Clark Terry, the jazz trumpeter, are featured performers in today's Composers' Showcase program at 6:45 P.M. and 9:30 P.M. at the Whitney Museum of American Art, Madison Avenue at 75th Street. This is a rare app...
docs.lead_paragraph: HORN OF PLENTY Vanessa Redgrave and Clark Terry, the jazz trumpeter, are featured performers in today's Composers' Showcase program at 6:45 P.M. and 9:30 P.M. at the Whitney Museum of American Art, Madison Avenue at 75th Street. This is a rare appearance here by the British actress, who is best known in this country for her screen roles.

docs.snippet: CARACAS--Against the expectation of many, Gen. Augusto Pinochet Ugarte is still supreme in Chile. Twenty-eight months after a military coup overthrew the Allende administration, General Pinochet wields greater power than all but a few Presidents h...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS--Against the expectation of many, Gen. Augusto Pinochet Ugarte is still supreme in Chile. Twenty-eight months after a military coup overthrew the Allende administration, General Pinochet wields greater power than all but a few Presidents have had in the country's century and a half of independence.
docs.abstract: Comment on Portuguese Govt shift from pro-Communism to more moderate socialism or soc dem (M)

headline.main: Politically Subtle; Repression, Guile Keep Pinochet on Top in Chile A Leader Emerges The Troubles Multiply The World Continued Communism Is Still Too Much Portugal's Confident Steps
